result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle M. Garza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

letter from E. Guerrero returned
E. Guerrero provided a self addressed stamp envelope
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Michelle M. Garza in court with attorney Mark David Lawton.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the matter was set for JT however, the matter is resolved.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement. Atty Lawton agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Lawton makes sentecing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Withhold Sentence: 12 months Probation with conditions:
30 days in the Marquette County Jail; stayed for the use of the Agent to lift the stay for violations
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
No contact with K.G.
Restitution = $406.18 + $40.61 surcharge = $446.79
Comply with any and all counseling or treatment as recommended by the Agent

**Defendant has paid Restitution in full and COC office is to pay out Restitution to the victim.
